III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth was physically abused by a staff member at facility. Youth
does not feel safe and continues to AWOL.
Investigation This complaint was received on 05/12/2023, assigned on
05/17/2023 and investigated jointly with the MDHHS Specialist.
I interviewed Director at the facility on 05/17/2023, in collaboration
with MDHHS Specialist 1. Director reported Youth A has been at
the facility for two weeks and has gone AWOL 9 times. His worker
is immediately notified and updated. Weekly meetings are held
with the team to discuss placement due to concerns for Youth A
going AWOL. Youth A went AWOL this morning and was gone for
approximately 30 minutes. While speaking with Director Youth A
came back to the facility and appeared to be under the influence,
so staff will be taking him to the hospital for a physical exam and
assessment. We requested to interview Youth A before being
transported to the hospital. There are no incident reports involving
Youth A being assaulted by staff or restrained. There was one
incident on 05/11/23 where Youth A attempted to assault Youth B.
I interviewed Youth A at the facility on 05/17/2023, in Collaboration
with MDHHS Specialist 1. Youth A provided his name and when
asked questions about the allegations his response to all the
questions was “10”. Youth A refused to answer the questions.
I interviewed Youth B at the facility on 05/17/2023 in collaboration
with MDHHS Specialist. Youth B has been at the facility for 2
months. He denied witnessing staff hit Youth A. He reported Youth
A is the one that threatens staff and other youths. He said last
week he was in the gym with Youth A and that’s when Youth A
attempted to assault him, but staff intervened and got him out of
the gym. He denied being assaulted by staff and expressed no
safety concerns.
2

A second complaint was received on 05/18/2023, alleging Staff
punched Youth A in the nose, Youth A was observed and did not
have bruises or marks.
I interviewed complainant/JJ Worker on 05/18/2023. She reported
Youth A was very vague and would not provide specific details
regarding when this occurred or who is physically abusing him.
Youth A did not report having any bruises or injuries. Police were
called on 05/17/2023 because Youth A assaulted a staff member.
Youth A said Staff punched him in the nose, but Youth A did not
have bruises or marks. Youth A got in trouble for assaulting the
staff, so she could not be sure he said he got hit by staff because
he got in trouble for assaulting the staff. Youth A has a history of
going AWOL and being aggressive.
I interviewed Youth A at the facility on 05/23/2023 in collaboration
with MDHHS Specialist 1. Youth A was more engaging and
cooperated with answering the questions. He reported he has
been at the facility for 3 weeks. Youth A admitted that he grabbed
Staff 1’s bag and dumped it on the floor, because he was upset.
He denied that staff punched him in the face. He denied pushing
or assaulting Staff. Youth A refused to answer any more questions
and walked out of the room.
I interviewed Youth C at the facility on 05/23/2023, in collaboration
with MDHHS Specialist. Youth C reported he was in his room on
05/17/2023 and heard Youth A yelling, he went to see what was
going on, and saw Youth A push and hit Staff 2. He said Youth A
also grabbed Staff 1’s bag and threw it on the floor. He denied
seeing Staff 2 hit or punch Youth A. He denied witnessing staff hit
or punch any other resident. Youth C reported feeling safe and
expressed no concerns regarding staff or the facility.
I interviewed Staff 1 at the facility on 05/23/2023, in collaboration
with MDHHS Specialist. Staff 1 is the supervisor and has been
working at the facility for 3 years. She indicated there has been no
incident involving Youth A being physical managed or assaulted
by staff. There was one incident on 05/17/2023 involving Youth A
assaulting Staff 2, grabbing her bag and dumping it on the floor.
She was informed of the incident and immediately removed Staff 1
from the unit. The police were contacted. She reported Staff 2 has
been working at the facility for 8 months and has no disciplinary
actions.
I interviewed Staff 2 at the facility on 05/23/2023, in collaboration
with MDHHS Specialist. Staff 2 reported that on 05/17/2023, she
3

was on the 3rd floor with Youth C, who was not feeling well. Youth
A came upstairs and when she tried to tell him to go back
downstairs, he got very angry, and told her, “Shut up bitch, I will
beat your ass”, pushed her, and grabbed her bag and dumped on
the floor. She said Staff 3 attempted to redirect Youth A and tried
to get him to calm down. She denied punching or threatening
Youth A.
I interviewed Staff 3 on 06/09/2023, in collaboration with MDHHS
Specialist. He reported on 05/17/2023, he was on the 3rd floor and
overheard Youth A arguing with Staff 2, he tried to talk to Youth A
but Youth A was escalated and charged at Staff 2. He did witness
Youth A grab Staff 2’s arm but did not see Youth A hit Staff 2.
Staff 3 was able to redirect Youth A to let go of Staff 2’s arm and
go back to his room. He said Youth A was threating Staff 2, but
could not recall exactly what Staff 2 said to Youth A. He said it
could have been “if you hit me, I will hit you back.” Staff 3 denied
witnessing Staff 2 punch or hit Youth A.
DHHS Predisposition conference held on 06/13/2023 with MDHHS
Specialist and Supervisor, who had no findings.
Documents Reviewed:
• Incident reports dated 5/7/23; Youths were in the first-floor
lounge area and were instructed to clean up the area where
they ate. While being redirected Youth A ran out of the
lounge area out to the parking lot stairwell. Police report
was filed.
• Incident Report 5/8/23 Staff was opening the bathroom and
Youth A ran in different directions. Youth A ran out the
Dickerson door. Staff tried to redirect however youth
ignored them. Police report filed.
• Incident Report 5/9/23 While standing in the first-floor
hallway medication time. Youth A went AWOL out of the
parking lot door. Staff and supervisor intervened to talk to
Youth A unsuccessful. Police report filed.
• Incident Report 5/10/23; Youth A was scheduled for a
medical assessment. Youth A was called into the office and
he ran out of the door and headed out of the back stairwell
entrance. Police were contacted.
• Incident Report 5/10/23; Youth A went AWOL while outside
on the playground. Police were contacted.
• Behavior Notification 5/11/23; Youth A asked Youth B to
play basketball, Youth B did not want to play, Youth A ran up
to Youth B and tried to punch him. Staff intervened and
removed Youth B from the gym.
4

• Incident report dated 05/17/2023; Youth A came to the 3rd
floor without staff permission. Staff attempted to redirected
Youth A but he continued to yell. Youth A called Staff 2
“bitches” and threatened to hit Staff 2. Youth A grabbed
Staff 2’s bag and pushed her into the chair. Staff 3
intervened by guiding Youth A back to his room. Youth A
continued to threaten Staff 2, so the police were called.
Analysis The facility is in compliance with the rule as there is insufficient
evidence that staff are physical abusing Youth A, based on interviews
with Staff and Youths. Youth A appears to be the one that is
aggressive and assaultive towards staff and youths.
Consultation Provided:
Director was advised to ensure staff are not verbally engaging with
youths and using any threatening language when a youth is
escalated.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
